result.execSummary:
The defendant Dan William Willison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

For payment plan.  Granted.  Defendant and wife mailed PPDS

Prosecutor Lyndsey A.B. Brunette and Defendant, Dan William Willison, in custody, appeared with Attorney Matthew Prior.  Defendant WAIVED PRELIMINARY HEARING and acknowledges signature.    Defendant agrees with Court appearing by video.  Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1.  Defendant acknowledges signature on plea questionnaire.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1, $300 plus costs, 60 DTP, ability to work off fine and costs if a program exists in Clark County and defendant is ordered to pay the $250 DNA surcharge and provide a sample for testing.   Count 2 is dismissed and read in.
Entered, Preliminary Hearing was waived and plea sentencing was held.

Preliminary hearing at 11-06-2015 08:30 am

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person via video conference from Clark County Jail with Attorney Prior appearing in person in court.  Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Waived reading of the complaint.  Waived time limits for the preliminary hearing.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Atty Prior
Adjourned initial appearance at 09-17-2015 10:20 am

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail  Defendant advised of right to an attorney  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 10:20 am.
